Class BatchImageEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • BatchImageEngine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<MetaMedia>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BatchConsole

    public abstract class BatchImageEngine
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<MetaMedia>

    Automates the batch processing of image files by copying the original files to a target directory, renaming them with a specified prefix, sorting them based on their original Date Taken attribute, and updating the creation date, last modification time, and last access time to match with the original Date Taken attribute, found in the image metadata.

    If the Date Taken attribute is missing or empty, a new property will be created based on the last modified time of the respective file.

    To access the sorted set of files programmatically, use an iterator in your implementation.

    Change History:

    • Version 1.0 - Initial release by Trevor Maggs on 19 March 2025
    Since:
    19 March 2025
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  BatchImageEngine.Builder
      This inner class implements a builder design pattern to construct an object in a step-by-step fashion, providing a clean and efficient approach for instantiation.
      private class  BatchImageEngine.NavigateDirectory
      An inner class extending SimpleFileVisitor navigates the source directory and extracts metadata from image files on the fly.

        private void createNewTargetDirectory()
                               throws BatchErrorException

        Throws:
        BatchErrorException - if an I/O error has occurred

      • updateDateTakenPNG

        public static void updateDateTakenPNG(java.io.File sourceFile,
                                      java.io.File targetFile,
                                      java.nio.file.attribute.FileTime datetime)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Copies the source image file to the target file and modifies the Date Taken property within the PNG textual chunk using the specified date-time parameter.
        Parameters:
        sourceFile - the original image file to be copied
        targetFile - the destination file, a copy of the specified source file
        datetime - the Date Taken property time to be updated
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs during processing

      • changeDateTimeMetadata

        protected static void changeDateTimeMetadata(java.io.File sourceFile,
                                             java.io.File targetFile,
                                             java.nio.file.attribute.FileTime datetime)
                                      throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                             java.io.IOException
        Copies the specified original image file to the target file, and updates the Date Taken property in the image metadata with the provided date-time parameter.
        Parameters:
        sourceFile - the original image file to be copied
        targetFile - the new target file, a copy of the specified source file
        datetime - The captured date-time to be updated
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the target file cannot be found
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs during processing

        protected static void changeFileTimeProperties(java.nio.file.Path fpath,

        Sets the last modified time, last accessed time, and creation time of an image file.
        Parameters:

        fileTime - the file time to set
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while setting the file times

      • copyToTarget

        protected abstract void copyToTarget()
                              throws BatchErrorException
        Targets subclasses for an implementation. The aim is to transfer files from a source directory to a target directory, renaming them with a specified prefix. The creation time, last modified time, and last access time of each file are then updated to match the Date Taken metadata property.
        Throws:
        BatchErrorException - if an error occurs during the file copy process
